detaileddescription.para: A channel snowflake id. Includes all channel types and categories
A mentionable. Includes users and roles

briefdescription.para: Represents command option types. These are the possible parameter value types.
respond to an interaction with a message
Acknowledge an interaction and edit a response later, the user sees a loading state.
for components, acknowledge an interaction and edit the original message later; the user does not see a loading state
for components, edit the message the component was attached to
Reply to autocomplete interaction. Be sure to do this within 500ms of the interaction!
Response types when responding to an interaction within on_interaction_create.

detaileddescription.para: Types of interaction in the dpp::interaction class

Racial and other slurs, hate speech.

briefdescription.para: an organizational category that contains up to 50 channels

briefdescription.para: a temporary sub-channel within a GUILD_ANNOUNCEMENT channel
a temporary sub-channel within a GUILD_TEXT channel
a temporary sub-channel within a GUILD_TEXT channel that is only viewable by those invited and those with the MANAGE_THREADS permission
a "stage" channel, like a voice channel with one authorised speaker
the channel in a hub containing the listed servers
forum channel that can only contain threads
Flag integers as received from and sent to discord.
Lock permissions (only used when updating channel positions)
Thread pinned in a forum (type 15) channel.
Our flags as stored in the object.

simplesect.para: The bottom four bits of this flag are reserved to contain the channel_type values listed above as provided by Discord. If discord add another value > 15, we will have to shuffle these values upwards by one bit.

briefdescription.para: Thread pinned in a forum (type 15) channel.
whether a tag is required to be specified when creating a thread in a forum channel. Tags are specified in the thread::applied_tags field.

The flags in discord channel's raw "flags" field. We use these for serialisation only, right now. Might be better to create a new field than to make the existing channel::flags from uint8_t to uint16_t, if discord adds more flags in future.
Sort forum posts by creation time (from most recent to oldest)
Types for sort posts in a forum channel.
Auto archive duration of 1 hour. (60 minutes)
Auto archive duration of 1 day. (1440 minutes)
Auto archive duration of 3 days. (4320 minutes)
Auto archive duration of 1 week. (10080 minutes)

Auto archive duration of threads which will stop showing in the channel list after the specified period of inactivity. Defined as an enum to fit into 1 byte. Internally it'll be translated to minutes to match the API.
Wait forever on a condition variable. The cluster will spawn threads for each shard and start() will not return in normal operation.

Return immediately after starting shard threads. If you set the parameter of cluster::start() to this value, you will have to manage the lifetime and scope of your cluster object yourself. Taking it out of scope or deleting its pointer will terminate the bot.

Parameter types when registering a command. We don't pass these in when triggering the command in the handler, because it is expected the developer added the command so they know what types to expect for each named parameter.
Available (false if the guild doesn't meet boosting criteria, etc)
99 [31:Float String] Float in string format (formatted "%.20e", sscanf "%lf"). Superseded by ett_new_float
112 [UInt32:Size, UInt8:Arity, 16*Uint6-MD5:Uniq, UInt32:Index, UInt32:NumFree, atom:Module, int:OldIndex, int:OldUniq, pid:Pid, NunFree*ext:FreeVars]
118 [UInt16:Len, Len:AtomName] max Len is 255 characters (up to 4 bytes per)
Represents a token which identifies the type of value which follows it in the ETF binary structure.

xrefdescription.para: Deprecated in favour of per-channel regions. Please use channel::rtc_region instead.

gm_deaf or gm_mute has been toggled

briefdescription.para: Various flags that can be used to indicate the status of a guild member.

simplesect.para: Use set_mute and set_deaf member functions and do not toggle the bits yourself.

briefdescription.para: Explicit content may be in this guild.
Guild NSFW level. Used to represent just how naughty this guild is. Naughty guild, go sit in the corner.

simplesect.para: This is set by Discord, and cannot be set by any bot or user on the guild.

briefdescription.para: media content will not be scanned
media content sent by members without roles will be scanned
media content sent by all members will be scanned
explicit content filter level. This is set by a guild admin, but can be forced to a setting if the server is verified, partnered, official etc.
MFA level for server. If set to elevated all moderators need MFA to perform specific actions such as kick or ban.
must have verified email on account
must be registered on Discord for longer than 5 minutes
must be a member of the server for longer than 10 minutes
must have a verified phone number
members will receive notifications for all messages by default
members will receive notifications only for messages that @mention them by default
guild has not unlocked any Server Boost perks

guild has unlocked Server Boost level 3 perks

briefdescription.para: intents are a bitmask of allowed events on your websocket.

detaileddescription.para: Some of these are known as Privileged intents (GUILD_MEMBERS and GUILD_PRESENCES) and require verification of a bot over 100 servers by discord via submission of your real life ID.

briefdescription.para: Action row, a container for other components.
Represents the type of a component.
An external hyperlink to a website.
Represents the style of a button.
Represents the type of a sticker.
The file format (png, apng, lottie) of a sticker.
this message has been published to subscribed channels (via Channel Following)
this message originated from a message in another channel (via Channel Following)
do not include any embeds when serializing this message
the source message for this crosspost has been deleted (via Channel Following)
this message came from the urgent message system
this message has an associated thread, with the same id as the message
this message is only visible to the user who invoked the Interaction
this message is an Interaction Response and the bot is "thinking"
this message failed to mention some roles and add their members to the thread

request aggressively on seeing new guilds, and also store missing data from messages. This is the default behaviour and the least memory-efficient option. Memory usage will increase over time, initially quite rapidly, and then linearly over time. It is the least cpu-intensive setting.
only cache when there is relevant activity, e.g. a message to the bot. This is a good middle-ground, memory usage will increase linearly over time.
Don't cache anything. Fill details when we see them. This is the most memory-efficient option but consumes more CPU time.
Represents the caching policy of a cache in the library.
Supported image types for profile pictures.
allows all permissions and bypasses channel permission overwrites
allows management and editing of channels
allows management and editing of the guild
allows for the addition of reactions to messages
allows for viewing of audit logs
allows for using priority speaker in a voice channel
allows the user to go live
allows guild members to view a channel, which includes reading messages in text channels and joining voice channels
allows for sending messages in a channel
allows for deletion of other users messages
links sent by users with this permission will be auto-embedded
allows for uploading images and files
allows for reading of message history
allows for using the everyone and the here tag to notify users in a channel
allows the usage of custom emojis from other servers
allows for joining of a voice channel
allows for speaking in a voice channel

allows for modification of own nickname

allows management and editing of emojis and stickers
allows members to use application commands, including slash commands and context menus

allows for management (creation, updating, deleting, starting) of scheduled events
allows for deleting and archiving threads, and viewing all private threads
allows for creating public and announcement threads
allows the usage of custom stickers from other servers
allows for sending messages in threads
allows for using activities (applications with the EMBEDDED flag) in a voice channel
allows for timing out users to prevent them from sending or reacting to messages in chat and threads, and from speaking in voice and stage channels

JSON data, text, UTF-8 character set.

Sending/receiving HTTP headers, acting as a standard HTTP connection. This is the state prior to receiving "HTTP/1.1 101 Switching Protocols" from the server side.
Connected as a websocket, and "upgraded". Now talking using binary frames.

memberdef.type: std::variant< std::monostate, std::string, int64_t, bool, snowflake, double >
memberdef.definition: typedef std::variant<std::monostate, std::string, int64_t, bool, snowflake, double> dpp::command_value
memberdef.name: command_value

briefdescription.para: This type is a variant that can hold any of the potential native data types represented by the enum dpp::command_option_type. It is used in interactions.

detaileddescription.para: std::monostate indicates an invalid parameter value, e.g. an unfilled optional parameter. std::int64_t will be for all integer options, double for decimal numbers and dpp::snowflake for anything ID related.
You can retrieve them with std::get().

briefdescription.para: A minimum or maximum value for co_number and co_integer dpp::command_option types.
A group of application slash commands.
A group of guild command permissions.

detaileddescription.para: A group of applications. This is not currently ever sent by Discord API but the DPP standard setup for objects that can be received by REST has the possibility for this, so this exists. Don't ever expect to see one at present.

briefdescription.para: A group of thread member objects.

memberdef.name: command_parameter

briefdescription.para: Represents a received parameter. We use variant so that multiple non-related types can be contained within.

Parameter list used during registration. Note that use of vector/pair is important here to preserve parameter order, as opposed to unordered_map (which doesn't guarantee any order at all) and std::map, which reorders keys alphabetically.
Parameter list for a called command. See dpp::parameter_registration_t for an explanation as to why vector is used.

memberdef.type: std::function< void(const std::string &, const parameter_list_t &, command_source)>

memberdef.name: command_handler

briefdescription.para: The function definition for a command handler. Expects a command name string, and a list of command parameters.

xrefdescription.para: commandhandler and message commands are deprecated and dpp::slashcommand is encouraged as a replacement.

briefdescription.para: Shorthand for the coroutine handle's type.
A function used as a callback for any REST based command.
Results of HTTP requests are called back to these std::function types.

simplesect.para: Returned http_completion_events are called ASYNCHRONOUSLY in your code which means they execute in a separate thread. The completion events arrive in order.

briefdescription.para: Call a D++ REST function synchronously.

detaileddescription.para: Synchronously calling a REST function means IT WILL BLOCK - This is a Bad Thing and strongly discouraged. There are very few circumstances you actually need this. If you do need to use this, you'll know it.

simplesect.para: As previously mentioned, this template will block. It is ill-advised to call this outside of a separate thread and this should never be directly used in any event such as dpp::cluster::on_interaction_create!

parameterdescription.para: type of expected return value, should match up with the method called
Type of class method in dpp::cluster to call.
pointer to class method in dpp::cluster to call. This can call any dpp::cluster member function who's last parameter is a dpp::command_completion_event_t callback type.
Zero or more arguments for the method call

simplesect.para: An instantiated object of type T

parameterdescription.para: On failure of the method call, an exception is thrown
